title: Rocket-propelled ship launches from the ground

content.question: When a rocket-propelled ship launches from the ground, it expels exhaust gas from the bottom of the ship, as shown above. Which of the following explains why the ship is able to leave the ground?

choices.label: The ship exerts a force on the ground, and the ground exerts a force of equal magnitude and in the opposite direction on the ship.
The gas exerts a force on the ground and a force of equal magnitude in the opposite direction on the ship.
The gravitational potential energy of the ship-Earth system decreases as the ship moves up, so the kinetic energy of the ship must increase.
The ship exerts a downward force on the gas, and the gas exerts an upward force on the ship.

content.answer: The ship exerts a downward force on the gas, and the gas exerts an upward force on the ship.
